page.title: 10THE M66 MOTORWAY
page.content: The{M66}is the most important road in our area.This road leads to other major roads,the{M62}and{M63}.The M66 was built in 1979.The M66 as it passes our school becomes the Edenfield/Rawtenstall by-pass which links with the Haslingden by-pass.Recently we checked the traffic on the motorway and there were approximately 850 vehicles an hour travelling towards Bury,and 880 vehicles an hour travelling towards Rawtenstall and Haslingden. Helmshore road is very old and was formerly a toll road. Also Market Street in Edenfield is over 200 years old. The M66 took most of the heavy traffic from Bolton Road North, which resulted in quieter roads in Edenfield and Stubbins.
